intro: Triotosiphon, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the eastern shores of the United States. The plant is characterized by its silvery, woolly leaves and striking blue or purple flower heads that resemble small holly berries. Triotosiphon thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in salt marshes and dunes. Its unique morphology and salt tolerance make it an important plant in coastal ecosystems.
